column1: Bünde [ˈbʏndə] (Low German Buine) is a town in the Herford district
The town is crossed from west to east by the River Else
column2: one of the few rivers in the world that does not originate from a spring
column3: but as a result of bifurcation. It drains the whole area and discharges via the Werre and Weser into the North Sea. Within the town area it is joined by numerous small streams from the south and north. One of the northern streams is the Gewinghauser Bach
column4: which on its way to the Else crosses water meadows in the district of Ennigloh-Gewinghausen. Other tributaries coming from the north in downstream order are the Ahler Bruchbach
column6: flows mainly through the district of Ahler Bruch and enters the Else in the Melle area; in addition there is the Darmühlenbach
column7: which also rises in Rödinghausen; then the Spradower Mühlenbach and finally the Eselsbach. From the south the Else is joined by the Werfener Bach.

column1: The two warriors shaking hands on the city's coat of arms are Hengist and Horsa
column2: Saxon princes said to have led the Germanic conquest of southern Britain in the 5th century. Legend holds that it was here the brother warriors put aside their differences and swore to conquer the island together

column1: About 30 million-year-old fossils were found in the Doberg
column2: including a skull of a toothed whale (Easqualadon langewieschei) and a skeleton of a manatee (Anemotherium langewieschei). Both were found 1911-1912 by Friedrich Langewiesche
column3: who became an honorary citizen of Bünde. The fossils are presented in 'Doberg Museum' in Bünde.

column1: The main industries are kitchen furniture and cigar manufacturers.
The town is called the Cigar Box of Germany. Many tobacco products such as pipes
column2: and tobacco jars are also produced here. The Westphalian tobacco industry is based here
column3: as well as the tobacco museums. Among companies based in the town
column4: the model maker Revell is known on the international stage. The European arm has been based here since 1957.

column1: The town supports the Nordwestdeutsche Philharmonie for regular symphony concerts.
